paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted genetic variant information for the TTR gene, including penetrance data.

patients.demographics: Age range varies, predominantly from endemic regions.

functional_data.summary: The Val30Met variant is the most common and well-studied mutation associated with ATTR-PN.

variants.segregation_data: Segregates with disease in families, particularly in endemic regions.
variants.population_frequency: Common in endemic regions such as Portugal and Sweden.
variants.evidence_level: Strong evidence based on numerous case studies.
variants.additional_notes: This variant is the most prevalent in the study population.
key_quotes: Val30Met was the most prevalent genotype reported in endemic countries.

patients.demographics: Age range varies, predominantly from endemic regions.

functional_data.summary: The Ser77Tyr variant is associated with a high penetrance of ATTR-PN.

variants.population_frequency: Less common than Val30Met but significant in certain populations.
variants.evidence_level: Moderate evidence based on case reports.
variants.additional_notes: Notable for high rates of non-motor visual symptoms.
key_quotes: A high rate of non-motor visual symptoms (i.e., visual opacities and glaucoma) in the Ser77Tyr cases versus all others (93% vs. 16%).

patients.demographics: Age range varies, predominantly from endemic regions.

functional_data.summary: The Ala97Ser variant is associated with a significant penetrance of ATTR-PN.

variants.evidence_level: Moderate evidence based on case reports.
variants.additional_notes: Notable for high rates of impotence among affected individuals.
key_quotes: A high rate of impotence among the Ala97Ser cases versus all others (67% vs. 21%).

patients.demographics: Age range varies, predominantly from endemic regions.

functional_data.summary: The Phe64Leu variant is associated with a high penetrance of ATTR-PN.

variants.evidence_level: Moderate evidence based on case reports.
variants.additional_notes: Mean age of onset was notably high.
key_quotes: Phe64Leu mean age of onset was 67.5 (SD 8.8; IQR 5.2) and mean age of diagnosis was 71.3 (SD 8.8; IQR 5.4).

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant variants in the TTR gene were extracted successfully.
